verses.verse: Now Jehoshaphat <S%H3092><s%> slept <S%H7901><s%> with his fathers <S%H1><s%>, and was buried <S%H6912><s%> with his fathers <S%H1><s%> in the city <S%H5892><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>. And Jehoram <S%H3088><s%> his son <S%H1121><s%> reigned <S%H4427><s%> in his stead.

And he had brethren <S%H251><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Jehoshaphat <S%H3092><s%>, Azariah <S%H5838><s%>, and Jehiel <S%H3171><s%>, and Zechariah <S%H2148><s%>, and Azariah <S%H5838><s%>, and Michael <S%H4317><s%>, and Shephatiah <S%H8203><s%>: all these were the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Jehoshaphat <S%H3092><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

And their father <S%H1><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> them great <S%H7227><s%> gifts <S%H4979><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%>, and of gold <S%H2091><s%>, and of precious things <S%H4030><s%>, with fenced <S%H4694><s%> cities <S%H5892><s%> in Judah <S%H3063><s%>: but the kingdom <S%H4467><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> he to Jehoram <S%H3088><s%>; because he was the firstborn <S%H1060><s%>.

Now when Jehoram <S%H3088><s%> was risen up <S%H6965><s%> to the kingdom <S%H4467><s%> of his father <S%H1><s%>, he strengthened <S%H2388><s%> himself, and slew <S%H2026><s%> all his brethren <S%H251><s%> with the sword <S%H2719><s%>, and divers also of the princes <S%H8269><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

¶ Jehoram <S%H3088><s%> was thirty <S%H7970><s%> and two <S%H8147><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he began to reign <S%H4427><s%>, and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> eight <S%H8083><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>.

And he walked <S%H3212><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%> of the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, like as did <S%H6213><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> of Ahab <S%H256><s%>: for he had the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Ahab <S%H256><s%> to wife <S%H802><s%>: and he wrought <S%H6213><s%> that which was evil <S%H7451><s%> in the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.

Howbeit the LORD <S%H3068><s%> would <S%H14><s%> not destroy <S%H7843><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>, because of the covenant <S%H1285><s%> that he had made <S%H3772><s%> with David <S%H1732><s%>, and as he promised <S%H559><s%> to give <S%H5414><s%> a light <S%H5216><s%> to him and to his sons <S%H1121><s%> for ever <S%H3117><s%>.
¶ In his days <S%H3117><s%> the Edomites <S%H123><s%> revolted <S%H6586><s%> from under the dominion <S%H3027><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and made <S%H4427><s%> themselves a king <S%H4428><s%>.

Then Jehoram <S%H3088><s%> went forth <S%H5674><s%> with his princes <S%H8269><s%>, and all his chariots <S%H7393><s%> with him: and he rose up <S%H6965><s%> by night <S%H3915><s%>, and smote <S%H5221><s%> the Edomites <S%H123><s%> which compassed him in <S%H5437><s%>, and the captains <S%H8269><s%> of the chariots <S%H7393><s%>.

So the Edomites <S%H123><s%> revolted <S%H6586><s%> from under the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> unto this day <S%H3117><s%>. The same time <S%H6256><s%> also did Libnah <S%H3841><s%> revolt <S%H6586><s%> from under his hand <S%H3027><s%>; because he had forsaken <S%H5800><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of his fathers <S%H1><s%>.

Moreover he made <S%H6213><s%> high places <S%H1116><s%> in the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and caused the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> to commit fornication <S%H2181><s%>, and compelled <S%H5080><s%> Judah <S%H3063><s%> thereto.

¶ And there came <S%H935><s%> a writing <S%H4385><s%> to him from Elijah <S%H452><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Thus saith <S%H559><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%> thy father <S%H1><s%>, Because thou hast not walked <S%H1980><s%> in the ways <S%H1870><s%> of Jehoshaphat <S%H3092><s%> thy father <S%H1><s%>, nor in the ways <S%H1870><s%> of Asa <S%H609><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>,

But hast walked <S%H3212><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%> of the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and hast made Judah <S%H3063><s%> and the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> to go a whoring <S%H2181><s%>, like to the whoredoms <S%H2181><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Ahab <S%H256><s%>, and also hast slain <S%H2026><s%> thy brethren <S%H251><s%> of thy father's <S%H1><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>, which were better <S%H2896><s%> than thyself:

Behold, with a great <S%H1419><s%> plague <S%H4046><s%> will the LORD <S%H3068><s%> smite <S%H5062><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%>, and thy children <S%H1121><s%>, and thy wives <S%H802><s%>, and all thy goods <S%H7399><s%>:

And thou shalt have great <S%H7227><s%> sickness <S%H2483><s%> by disease <S%H4245><s%> of thy bowels <S%H4578><s%>, until thy bowels <S%H4578><s%> fall out <S%H3318><s%> by reason of the sickness <S%H2483><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> by day <S%H3117><s%>.

¶ Moreover the LORD <S%H3068><s%> stirred up <S%H5782><s%> against Jehoram <S%H3088><s%> the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>, and of the Arabians <S%H6163><s%>, that were near <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3027><s%> the Ethiopians <S%H3569><s%>:

And they came up <S%H5927><s%> into Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and brake <S%H1234><s%> into it, and carried away <S%H7617><s%> all the substance <S%H7399><s%> that was found <S%H4672><s%> in the king's <S%H4428><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>, and his sons <S%H1121><s%> also, and his wives <S%H802><s%>; so that there was never a son <S%H1121><s%> left <S%H7604><s%> him, save Jehoahaz <S%H3059><s%>, the youngest <S%H6996><s%> of his sons <S%H1121><s%>.
¶ And after <S%H310><s%> all this the LORD <S%H3068><s%> smote <S%H5062><s%> him in his bowels <S%H4578><s%> with an incurable <S%H369><s%> <S%H4832><s%> disease <S%H2483><s%>.

And it came to pass, that in process of time <S%H3117><s%>, after <S%H3318><s%> <S%H6256><s%> the end <S%H7093><s%> of two <S%H8147><s%> years <S%H3117><s%>, his bowels <S%H4578><s%> fell out <S%H3318><s%> by reason <S%H5973><s%> of his sickness <S%H2483><s%>: so he died <S%H4191><s%> of sore <S%H7451><s%> diseases <S%H8463><s%>. And his people <S%H5971><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> no burning <S%H8316><s%> for him, like the burning <S%H8316><s%> of his fathers <S%H1><s%>.

Thirty <S%H7970><s%> and two <S%H8147><s%> years old <S%H1121><s%> was he when he began to reign <S%H4427><s%>, and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> eight <S%H8083><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>, and departed <S%H3212><s%> without being desired <S%H2532><s%>. Howbeit they buried <S%H6912><s%> him in the city <S%H5892><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>, but not in the sepulchres <S%H6913><s%> of the kings <S%H4428><s%>.
